Errors.PF2ESubsystemThemingText: PF2E Bestiary Tracking now requires the module PF2e Subsystem Theming for it's visual themes. You will have to enable it!

OpenBestiaryCombat.Name: Open Bestiary Combat Section
OpenBestiaryCombat.Hint: Takes you directly to all creatures involved in combat

ShowMonster.Name: Show Monster
ShowMonster.Hint: Opens the bestiary on the currently selected or targeted creature

AddMonster.Name: Add Monster
AddMonster.Hint: Adds the currently selected or targeted creature to the bestiary

ViewAsPlayer.Name: View Bestiary As Player
ViewAsPlayer.Hint: Holding this key lets you view the bestiary as if you were a player

Migration.MigrateInfluenceText: Influence events are now handled by the module PF2e Subsystems. Enable this module to automatically migrate your existing influence events.

ImportDialog.FaultyImport: The selected JSON file is not a valid Bestiary Entry.
ImportDialog.UnusedBestiaryType: You are not using this type of Bestiary Entry. Check your module settings.
ImportDialog.MissingName: You must provide a name for the imported Bestiary Entry!

BestiarySelection.Name: Bestiary Management
BestiarySelection.MissingFolderError: You have deleted the Bestiary folder. Cannot create new bestiary.
BestiarySelection.DeleteBestiaryText: Are you sure you want to delete this bestiary?
BestiarySelection.OldSaveStateImported: Old Save State successfully imported. Feel free to delete it.

Notifications.MissmatchedType: Entity type missmatch. Dragged actor is {new} and not {current}.

Bestiary.Title: Bestiary

PlayersSection.Title: For Players
PlayersSection.ThemingTip: Select your favorite visual theme for the Bestiary in the module settings
PlayersSection.NavigationTip: Navigate between different creature types using the bookmarks on the left.
PlayersSection.MacroTip: Check the module's compendium and add useful macros to your hotbar.

GMsSection.Title: For GMs
GMsSection.AddCreaturesTip: Add new creatures the players have encountered by dragging them into the bestiary.
GMsSection.ModuleSettingsTip: Customize module behavior and the way monster information is shown in the module settings.
GMsSection.ToggleInformationTip: Toggle known information on individual monsters as the players learn information.
GMsSection.ToggleMisinformationTip: Toggle misinformation on a field. Enter false information and remove it the same way.
GMsSection.RecallKnowledgeJournalMissing: Drag a journal here to give players a link to your recall knowledge rules.
GMsSection.RecallKnowledgeAttachedNotification: You've added a link to your recall knowledge rules.

CategoryView.EmptyText: No {category} creature encountered yet. Enjoy it while you can.
CategoryView.EmptyCategoryText: You haven't met anyone under the {category} classification
CategoryView.EmptyHazardText: You haven't run into any {category} hazards. Yet.
CategoryView.UnaffiliatedText: You don't know any unaffiliated characters..

Miscellaneous.CategoryPlaceholder: Add categories the NPC is affiliated with

Tips.ToggleHideTabs: Rightclick to toggle a hidden tab

NPC.NPCCategoryDescription: NPCs are sorted into categories created by the GM. Remove categories by rightclicking their bookmarks.
NPC.TransformNPCText: Are you sure you want to transform this NPC into a creature? Any NPC data you've added will be lost.
NPC.GMNotesImportText: Select a page to import text from. This will overwrite any existing text in the GM Notes.
NPC.GMPlayersContainerTip: Dropping anything on a player's image acts the same as dropping them on the player token.
NPC.GMTextZoneTip: Drag and drop a journal onto the text area to import text from it.

UnlinkedDialog.Title: Unlinked Create Handling
UnlinkedDialog.Content: The current creature lacks an actor in the world. Would you like to create one for it?

Errors.DataMissing: Some data is missing. You'll have to reimport the creature. Sorry about that!
Errors.ActorMissing: There is no linked Actor for the entity in the world.

Info.GMOnly: This is a GM only function.
Info.BestiaryEntryLinkTip: Copy link (+Alt to send to chat)
Info.BestiaryOpenMacro: Bestiary Open Macro copied to clipboard.
Info.RefreshFinishedPartial: Bestiary refresh finished. Some entities did not have linked actors and were not refreshed [{entities}]

Sheet.BestiaryAddText: This actor is not currently in the Bestiary. Do you want to add it?

Bestiary.RemoveBookmarkText: Are you sure you want to remove the {category} category?
Bestiary.ResetRecallAttemptsText: Are you sure you want to reset the recall attempt history of {character}?

VagueDescriptions.Name: Vague Descriptions
VagueDescriptions.Hint: Toggle which monster qualities should be displayed using High/Medium/Low instead of exact values.

Menu.Name: Vague Descriptions
Menu.Label: Vague Description Settings
Menu.Hint: Toggle monster properties where values should be vague

BestiaryLabels.Name: Bestiary Labels
BestiaryLabels.Hint: Exchange labels used in the bestiary for custom ones

Menu.Name: Bestiary Labels
Menu.Label: Bestiary Label Settings
Menu.Hint: Customize labels and used in the Bestiary

Menu.Name: Bestiary Contents
Menu.Label: Bestiary Content Settings
Menu.Hint: Customize what is displayed, and how it's displayed within the Bestiary

AdditionalCreatureTypes.Name: Additional Creature Types
AdditionalCreatureTypes.SubText: You can add more available creature traits to choose from in the PF2E System Settings for Homebrew.

BestiaryAppearance.Name: Bestiary Appearance
BestiaryAppearance.Hint: Customize the appearance of the Bestiary

Menu.Name: Bestiary Appearance
Menu.Label: Bestiary Appearance Settings
Menu.Hint: Customize the appearance of the Bestiary

Menu.Name: Bestiary Integration
Menu.Label: Bestiary Integration Settings
Menu.Hint: Customize the way you can interact with the Bestiary

Menu.Name: Bestiary Custom Themes
Menu.Label: Custom Themes
Menu.Hint: Add and edit custom visual themes for the bestiary

Import.Title: Import Bestiary Theme
Import.FaultyImport: JSON file is not a bestiary theme!

AutomaticCombatRegistration.Name: Combat Registration
AutomaticCombatRegistration.Hint: Automtically add new enemies to the Bestiary during a selected stage of combat.

NPCRegistation.Name: NPC Registration
NPCRegistation.Hint: Select the way NPCs will be recognised by the bestiary

Choices.UniqueTag: Either Unique Rarity or NPC Tag

HideTokenNames.Name: Mystify Token Names
HideTokenNames.Hint: Set token names based on their bestiary status so as to not reveal information.

AutomaticallyOpenMonster.Name: Auto Open Bestiary Entry
AutomaticallyOpenMonster.Hint: Automatically open the bestiary entry for monsters you drop into it.

DoubleClickOpen.Name: Double Click Open
DoubleClickOpen.Hint: Opens a creature's Bestiary entry when their token is doubleclicked(+ ALT for GM). With this setting active, all creatures in the Bestiary get their Ownership level set to 'Limited' for the players.

ContrastRevealState.Name: Contrast Reveal State
ContrastRevealState.Hint: Option for GMs to see hidden/revealed fields in contrast colors

BestiaryDefaultTheme.Name: Bestiary Default Theme
BestiaryDefaultTheme.Hint: Select the default visual theme for the Bestiary

BestiaryTheme.Name: Bestiary Theme
BestiaryTheme.Hint: Select the visual theme for the Bestiary

ShowMonster.NoActor: The creature has no actor in the world and is unlinked in the Bestiary.
ShowMonster.InvalidTarget: Target must be an NPC creature!
ShowMonster.TargetNotInBestiary: That monster hasn't been added to the bestiary yet!

OpenBestiaryCombat.NoActiveCombat: There is no current active combat

AddMonster.GMOnly: This macro can only be used by the GM.
AddMonster.TargetAlreadyInBestiary: That creature is already in the bestiary!

ResetBestiary.Title: Reset Bestiary
ResetBestiary.Text: This will remove all current data from your bestiary. Are you sure you want to do this?

DeactivateModule.GMOnly: This macro can only be used by the GM.
DeactivateModule.Title: PF2E Bestiary Tracking Deactivation
DeactivateModule.Name: Deactivate Bestiary Tracking Module

Text.FirstPart: This will deactivate the module and safely store the Bestiary data in the journal folder BestiaryTracking Bestiares.
Text.SecondPart: If you delete this folder's contents and active the module again, the Bestiary data will be gone.

DeactivateModule.DependencyResolutionWarning: Use the {name} macro instead to avoid console errors after deactivation.
